intro: Kyrstenia incarnata, commonly known as the pink kyrstenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in soft, velvety hairs. Its flowers are small, pinkish-white, and clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
